translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The twentieth chapter
The discussion of fetters

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya arahatta ppatti iti
translated: “Is there any fetter that one who has attained worthiness is not without?”
“Yes.”

original: Atthi kiñci sakkāyadiṭṭhiṁ appahāya …pe…🔽vicikicchaṁ appahāya …pe…🔽sīlabbataparāmāsaṁ appahāya …
analyzed: atthi kiñci sakkāyadiṭṭhim a pahāya pe  vicikiccham appahāya pe  sīlabbata parāmāsam a pahāya
translated: “Is there any personality view that one who has attained worthiness is not without?”🔽“Is there any doubt…
“Is there any adherence to rules and observances…🔽“Is there any lust…🔽“Is there any hate…
“Is there any delusion…
“Is there any lack of conscience that one who has attained worthiness is not without?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya arahatta ppatti iti
translated: “Is there any fetter that one who has attained worthiness is not without?”
“Yes.”

original: Arahā sarāgo sadoso samoho samāno samakkho sapaḷāso saupāyāso sakilesoti?
analyzed: arahā sa rāgaḥ sa dosaḥ sa mohaḥ samānaḥ sa makkhaḥ sa paḷāsaḥ sa upāyāsaḥ sa kilesaḥ ti
translated: “Is a Worthy One possessed of lust, possessed of hate, possessed of delusion, possessed of conceit, possessed of misapprehension, possessed of anxiety, possessed of defilements?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: nanu arahā nirāgo niddoso nimmoho nimmāno nimmakkho nippaḷāso nirupāyāso nikkilesoti?
analyzed: nanu arahā nirāgaḥ niddosaḥ nimmohaḥ nimmānaḥ nimmakkhaḥ nippaḷāsaḥ nirupāyāsaḥ nikkilesaḥ
translated: “Then isn’t it the case that a Worthy One is without lust, without hate, without delusion, without conceit, without misapprehension, without anxiety, without defilements?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci arahā nirāgo …pe…🔽nikkileso, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci arahā nirāgo pe  nikkilesaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “So it is the case that a Worthy One is without lust…

analyzed: atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya arahatta ppatti iti
translated: without defilements, but it is not the case that ‘There is some fetter that one who has attained worthiness is not without.’“
“It is not to be said that

analyzed: kiñci sayojanam appahāya arahatta ppatti iti
translated: “Having not abandoned any fetter, has one attained perfection?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: arahā sabbam buddha visayam jānāti iti
translated: “Does an arahant know the entire range of the Buddha’s knowledge?”
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”

original: Tena hi atthi kiñci saṁyojanaṁ appahāya arahattappattīti.
analyzed: tena hi atthi kiñci sayojanam a pahāya arahatta ppatti iti
translated: “Well then, does an arahant attain perfection without having abandoned any fetter?”
The Discussion of Fetters is finished.
